instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message: This board is working normally except it has no sound. System Presences says no audio device. <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> is producing 4.5V. There is 3.3V coming through L6201. Any idea where to look next?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message:
Any history of the board ? Liquid etc ?

Have you tried known good OSX image as a starting point ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message:
No Title

Yes, liquid damage. Nothing major but there was some slight damage in the audio area. Ultrasonic-only fix up to this point. I tried multiple OS test systems. No change.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message: Might still be corrosion under <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>, bad chip, or broken/corroded HDA line  back to PCH.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message: Usually corroded trace around <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>. Also check resistors in the HDA lines to the PCH.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message: Thanks for the tips. Had a short on <SIGNAL>PD_CS4208_GPIO1</SIGNAL> line from pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R6323</RESISTOR> to <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>. I'm going to replace <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and see if that fixes the problem. The short is gone with it removed so I think we're going in the right direction.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Sound
threads.message: Working fine after replacing <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>. Thanks for the help.
